translation: In the eighth month, in the second year of Darius, the word of the LORD came to Zechariah son of Berechiah, son of Iddo the prophet, saying,
The LORD was exceedingly angry with your fathers.
And you shall say to them, Thus says the LORD of hosts: Return to Me, declares the LORD of hosts, and I will return to you, says the LORD of hosts.

Do not be like your fathers, to whom the former prophets cried, saying, “Thus says the LORD of hosts: Return now from your evil ways and from your evil deeds.” But they did not listen, nor did they give heed to Me, declares the LORD.
Your fathers, where are they? And the prophets, do they live forever?

But surely My words and My statutes, which I commanded My servants the prophets, did they not overtake your fathers? And they turned and said, “As the LORD of hosts purposed to do to us, according to our ways and according to our deeds, so has He dealt with us.”
On the twenty-fourth day of the eleventh month, which is the month Shebat, in the second year of Darius, the word of the LORD came to Zechariah son of Berechiah, son of Iddo the prophet, saying:
I saw in the night, and behold, a man riding upon a red horse, and he stood among the myrtle trees that were in the hollow, and behind him were horses, red, sorrel, and white.
And I said, “What are these, my lord?” And the angel who spoke with me said to me, “I will show you what these are.”
And the man who stood among the myrtle trees answered and said, These are those whom the LORD has sent to walk to and fro in the earth.
And they answered the angel of the LORD who stood among the myrtle trees, and said, We have walked to and fro through the earth, and behold, all the earth sits still and is at rest.
And the angel of the LORD answered and said, O LORD of hosts, how long will you not have compassion on Jerusalem and on the cities of Judah, against which you have been indignant these seventy years?
And the LORD answered the angel who spoke with me with good words, words of comfort.
And the angel who spoke with me said to me, Proclaim, saying, Thus says the LORD of hosts: I am zealous for Jerusalem and for Zion with great zeal.
And with great wrath I am wrathful against the nations that are at ease; for I was but a little angry, and they helped forward the calamity.
Therefore thus says the LORD: I have returned to Jerusalem with mercies; My house shall be built in her, declares the LORD of hosts, and a measuring line shall be stretched out over Jerusalem.
Cry out again, saying, Thus says the LORD of hosts: My cities shall again overflow with prosperity, and the LORD shall again comfort Zion, and shall again choose Jerusalem.
And I lifted up my eyes and saw, and behold, four horns.
And I said to the angel who spoke with me, “What are these?” And he said to me, “These are the horns that have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.”
And the LORD showed me four craftsmen.

And I said, “What are these coming to do?” And he spoke, saying, “These are the horns that scattered Judah, so that no man lifted up his head; and these have come to terrify them, to cast down the horns of the nations that lifted up their horn against the land of Judah, to scatter it.”
And I lifted up my eyes and saw, and behold, a man, and in his hand a measuring line.
And I said, “Where are you going?” And he said to me, “To measure Jerusalem, to see how great is its width and how great is its length.”
And behold, the angel who spoke with me went forth, and another angel went out to meet him.
And he said to him, Run, speak to that young man, saying, Jerusalem shall dwell as unwalled villages because of the multitude of people and cattle in her midst.
And I, declares the LORD, will be to her a wall of fire all around, and I will be the glory in her midst.
Ho, ho, flee from the land of the north, declares the LORD, for I have spread you abroad like the four winds of the heavens, declares the LORD.
Ho, Zion, escape, you who dwell with the daughter of Babylon.
For thus says the LORD of hosts: After glory he has sent me to the nations that plunder you, for whoever touches you touches the apple of his eye.
For behold, I am swinging My hand over them, and they shall be plunder for their own servants; and you shall know that the LORD of hosts has sent Me.
Sing and rejoice, daughter of Zion, for behold, I am coming, and I will dwell in your midst, declares the LORD.
Many nations shall join themselves to the LORD in that day, and shall be My people; and I will dwell in your midst, and you shall know that the LORD of hosts has sent Me to you.
And the LORD shall inherit Judah as his portion in the holy land, and shall again choose Jerusalem.
Be silent, all flesh, before the LORD, for He has roused Himself from His holy dwelling.
And he showed me Joshua the high priest standing before the angel of the LORD, and Satan standing at his right hand to accuse him.
And the LORD said to Satan, “The LORD rebuke you, O Satan; indeed, the LORD who has chosen Jerusalem rebuke you. Is not this a brand plucked from the fire?”
Now Joshua was clothed with filthy garments and was standing before the angel.

And he answered and spoke to those who stood before him, saying, Remove the filthy garments from off him. And he said to him, See, I have caused your iniquity to pass from you, and I will clothe you with rich garments.
And I said, Let them set a clean turban upon his head. So they set the clean turban upon his head, and clothed him with garments, and the angel of the LORD stood by.
And the angel of the LORD solemnly charged Joshua, saying:

Thus says the LORD of hosts: If you walk in My ways, and if you keep My charge, then you also shall judge My house, and you also shall keep My courts, and I will grant you access among these who stand here.
Hear now, Joshua the high priest, you and your companions who sit before you, for they are men of a sign; for behold, I am bringing forth My servant, the Branch.

For behold, the stone that I have set before Joshua, upon one stone are seven eyes; behold, I am engraving its engraving, declares the LORD of hosts, and I will remove the iniquity of that land in one day.
In that day, declares the LORD of hosts, you will invite each man his neighbor to sit under the vine and under the fig tree.
And the angel who spoke with me returned and roused me, as a man is roused out of his sleep.

And he said to me, What do you see? And I said, I have seen, and behold, a lampstand all of gold, with its bowl upon its top, and its seven lamps upon it, seven and seven channels to the lamps which are upon its top.
And two olive trees are by it, one on the right of the bowl, and one on its left.
And I answered and said to the angel who spoke with me, saying, “What are these, my lord?”
Then the angel who spoke with me answered and said to me, “Do you not know what these are?” And I said, “No, my lord.”
Then he answered and spoke to me, saying, This is the word of the LORD to Zerubbabel, saying, Not by might, nor by power, but by My Spirit, says the LORD of hosts.
Who are you, O great mountain? Before Zerubbabel you shall become a plain, and he shall bring forth the top stone with shouts of “Grace, grace to it!”
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying:
The hands of Zerubbabel have laid the foundation of this house, and his hands shall also finish it; and you shall know that the LORD of hosts has sent me to you.

For who has despised the day of small things? And they shall rejoice and shall see the plummet stone in the hand of Zerubbabel; these seven are the eyes of the LORD, which roam to and fro through all the earth.
Then I answered and said to him, What are these two olive trees on the right of the lampstand and on its left?
And I answered a second time and said to him, What are the two branches of the olive trees which are beside the two golden pipes that pour out the gold from upon them?
And he said to me, saying, “Do you not know what these are?” And I said, “No, my lord.”
And he said, These are the two sons of oil, who stand by the Lord of all the earth.
And I turned and lifted up my eyes and saw, and behold, a flying scroll.
And he said to me, What do you see? And I said, I see a flying scroll; its length is twenty cubits, and its breadth ten cubits.

And he said to me, This is the curse that goes forth over the face of all the earth; for everyone who steals shall be purged away, on the one side according to it, and everyone who swears shall be purged away, on the other side according to it.

I have brought it forth, declares the LORD of hosts, and it shall enter into the house of the thief and into the house of him who swears falsely by My name, and it shall lodge in the midst of his house and shall consume it, both its timber and its stones.
Then the angel who spoke with me went forth and said to me, Lift up now your eyes and see what this is that goes forth.
And I said, What is it? And he said, This is the ephah that goes forth. And he said, This is their eye in all the earth.
And behold, a round weight of lead was lifted up, and there was a woman sitting in the midst of the ephah.
And he said, “This is wickedness.” And he thrust her down into the ephah, and he cast the weight of lead upon its mouth.

And I lifted up my eyes and saw, and behold, two women were coming out, and the wind was in their wings; and they had wings like the wings of a stork, and they lifted up the ephah between the earth and the heavens.
And I said to the angel who spoke with me, “Where are they taking the ephah?”
And he said to me, To build for her a house in the land of Shinar; and it shall be prepared, and she shall be set there upon her own base.
And I turned and lifted up my eyes and saw, and behold, four chariots were coming out from between two mountains, and the mountains were mountains of bronze.
In the first chariot were red horses, and in the second chariot black horses.
And in the third chariot were white horses, and in the fourth chariot dappled strong horses.
And I answered and said to the angel who spoke with me, “What are these, my lord?”
And the angel answered and said to me, These are the four winds of heaven, going out from standing before the Lord of all the earth.
Those with the black horses go out toward the land of the north, and the white go out after them, and the dappled go out toward the land of the south.
And the strong ones went out and sought to go, to walk to and fro in the earth. And he said, Go, walk to and fro in the earth. So they walked to and fro in the earth.
And he cried out to me and spoke to me, saying, Behold, those who go forth toward the land of the north have given rest to My Spirit in the land of the north.
And the word of the LORD came to me, saying.
Take from the exiles, from Heldai, and from Tobijah, and from Jedaiah, and go you on that day, and go into the house of Josiah son of Zephaniah, who have come from Babylon.
And you shall take silver and gold, and make crowns, and set them upon the head of Joshua son of Jehozadak, the high priest.
And you shall speak to him, saying, Thus says the LORD of hosts, saying, Behold, a man whose name is Branch; and from beneath him he shall spring forth, and he shall build the temple of the LORD.

He shall build the temple of the LORD, and he shall bear majesty, and shall sit and rule upon his throne; and he shall be a priest upon his throne, and the counsel of peace shall be between them both.
And the crowns shall be for Helem, and for Tobijah, and for Jedaiah, and for Hen the son of Zephaniah, for a memorial in the temple of the LORD.

And those who are far off shall come and build in the temple of the LORD, and you shall know that the LORD of hosts has sent me to you. And it shall come to pass, if you will indeed listen to the voice of the LORD your God.
And it came to pass in the fourth year of Darius the king, that the word of the LORD came to Zechariah on the fourth day of the ninth month, which is Kislev.
Now Bethel had sent Sharezer and Regem-melech and his men to entreat the favor of the LORD.
To speak to the priests who belong to the house of the LORD of hosts, and to the prophets, saying, “Shall I weep in the fifth month, separating myself, as I have done these so many years?”
And the word of the LORD of hosts came to me, saying,
Say to all the people of the land and to the priests, saying, When you fasted and mourned in the fifth and in the seventh month, even these seventy years, was it indeed for Me that you fasted?
And when you eat and when you drink, is it not you who are eating, and you who are drinking?

Are these not the words which the LORD proclaimed by the hand of the former prophets, when Jerusalem was inhabited and at ease, with her cities round about her, and the Negev and the lowland were inhabited?
And the word of the LORD came to Zechariah, saying:
Thus says the LORD of hosts: Render true judgment, and practice kindness and compassion each one toward his brother.
And widow and orphan, sojourner and poor, do not oppress; and the evil of one against his brother do not devise in your hearts.
But they refused to listen, and turned a stubborn shoulder, and made their ears heavy so as not to hear.

And they made their hearts like flint, so as not to hear the law and the words which the LORD of hosts sent by His Spirit through the former prophets; therefore great wrath came from the LORD of hosts.
And it came to pass, as He called and they would not listen, so they shall call and I will not listen, says the LORD of hosts.

And I scattered them with a storm among all the nations whom they had not known, and the land was desolate after them, without passerby and without return; and they made the pleasant land a desolation.
And the word of the LORD of hosts came, saying,
Thus says the LORD of hosts: I am jealous for Zion with great jealousy, and with great wrath I am jealous for her.
Thus says the LORD: I have returned to Zion and will dwell in the midst of Jerusalem, and Jerusalem shall be called the City of Truth, and the mountain of the LORD of hosts, the Holy Mountain.
Thus says the LORD of hosts: Old men and old women shall yet again sit in the streets of Jerusalem, each with his staff in his hand because of great age.
And the streets of the city shall be filled with boys and girls playing in its streets.
Thus says the LORD of hosts: If it is marvelous in the eyes of the remnant of this people in those days, will it also be marvelous in My eyes? declares the LORD of hosts.
Thus says the LORD of hosts: Behold, I am saving My people from the land of the rising and from the land of the setting of the sun.
And I will bring them, and they shall dwell in the midst of Jerusalem; and they shall be My people, and I will be their God, in truth and in righteousness.

Thus says the LORD of hosts: Let your hands be strong, you who in these days hear these words from the mouth of the prophets, who were in the day that the foundation was laid for the house of the LORD of hosts, the temple, to be built.

For before those days the wages of man were not, and the wages of beast were none; and to him who went out and to him who came in there was no peace because of the adversary, and I let loose all men, each one against his neighbor.
But now I am not as in the former days to the remnant of this people, declares the LORD of hosts.

For the seed shall be of peace; the vine shall give her fruit, and the earth shall give her increase, and the heavens shall give their dew; and I will cause the remnant of this people to inherit all these things.
And it shall come to pass that as you were a curse among the nations, O house of Judah and house of Israel, so will I save you, and you shall be a blessing. Do not fear; let your hands be strong.
For thus says the LORD of hosts: Just as I purposed to bring evil upon you when your fathers provoked Me to wrath, says the LORD of hosts, and I did not relent,
So again have I turned and purposed in these days to do good to Jerusalem and to the house of Judah; do not fear.
These are the things that you shall do: speak truth each one with his neighbor; truth and the judgment of peace judge in your gates.
And let none of you devise the evil of his neighbor in your heart, and love not a false oath; for all these are things that I hate, declares the LORD.
And the word of the LORD of hosts came to me, saying:

Thus says the LORD of hosts: The fast of the fourth month, and the fast of the fifth, and the fast of the seventh, and the fast of the tenth shall be to the house of Judah joy and gladness and cheerful feasts; therefore love truth and peace.
Thus says the LORD of hosts: Yet again peoples shall come, and the inhabitants of many cities.
And the inhabitants of one city shall go to another, saying, “Let us surely go to entreat the favor of the LORD and to seek the LORD of hosts; I also will go.”
And many peoples shall come, and mighty nations, to seek the LORD of hosts in Jerusalem, and to entreat the favor of the LORD.

Thus says the LORD of hosts: In those days ten men from all the languages of the nations shall take hold, they shall take hold of the corner of the garment of a Jewish man, saying, “We will go with you, for we have heard that God is with you.”
The burden of the word of the LORD in the land of Hadrach, and Damascus its resting place, for the eye of man and of all the tribes of Israel is toward the LORD.
And also Hamath, which borders on it, Tyre and Sidon, though she is very wise.
For Tyre built herself a stronghold, and heaped up silver like the dust, and fine gold like the mire of the streets.
Behold, the Lord will dispossess her, and will strike her power in the sea, and she herself shall be devoured by fire.

Ashkelon shall see and be afraid; Gaza also, and shall writhe exceedingly; and Ekron, for her expectation shall be put to shame. And the king shall perish from Gaza, and Ashkelon shall not be inhabited.
And a bastard shall dwell in Ashdod, and I will cut off the pride of the Philistines.
And I will take away his blood from his mouth, and his abominations from between his teeth; and he too shall remain for our God, and he shall be as a chief in Judah, and Ekron as a Jebusite.
And I will encamp about my house as a guard, against him that passes by and against him that returns; and no oppressor shall pass over them any more, for now I have seen with my own eyes.

Rejoice greatly, O daughter of Zion; shout aloud, O daughter of Jerusalem. Behold, your King comes to you, righteous and endowed with salvation is He, humble and riding upon a donkey, even upon a colt, the foal of a donkey.

And I will cut off the chariot from Ephraim, and the horse from Jerusalem; and the battle bow shall be cut off, and he shall speak peace to the nations; and his dominion shall be from sea to sea, and from the River to the ends of the earth.
As for you also, because of the blood of your covenant, I have sent forth your prisoners out of the pit in which there is no water.
Return to the stronghold, prisoners of hope; even today I declare that I will restore double to you.
For I have bent Judah for Me as a bow, I have filled the bow with Ephraim; and I will stir up your sons, O Zion, against your sons, O Greece, and I will make you like the sword of a mighty man.
Then the LORD will be seen over them, and His arrow shall go forth like lightning; and the Lord GOD will blow the trumpet, and will march in the stormwinds of the south.

The LORD of hosts will shield them, and they will devour and trample down the sling-stones; and they will drink and roar as with wine, and they will be filled like a bowl, like the corners of the altar.
And the LORD their God will save them in that day as the flock of His people, for they shall be as the stones of a crown, lifted up upon His land.
For how great is His goodness, and how great His beauty! Grain shall make the young men flourish, and new wine the maidens.
Ask of the LORD rain in the time of the latter rain; the LORD makes the lightning flashes, and He will give them showers of rain, to each man grass in the field.

For the household gods have spoken iniquity, and the diviners have seen a lie, and the empty dreams speak vanity; they comfort in vain. Therefore they have wandered like sheep, they are afflicted, because there is no shepherd.

Against the shepherds my anger is kindled, and upon the he-goats I will visit punishment; for the LORD of hosts has visited his flock, the house of Judah, and has made them like his majestic horse in battle.
From him shall come the cornerstone, from him the tent peg, from him the battle bow; from him shall go forth every ruler together.
They shall be like mighty men, treading down the mire of the streets in battle; and they shall fight, for the LORD is with them, and the riders on horses shall be put to shame.

And I will strengthen the house of Judah, and I will save the house of Joseph, and I will bring them back, for I have had compassion on them; and they shall be as though I had not cast them off, for I am the LORD their God, and I will answer them.
And Ephraim shall be like a mighty man, and their heart shall rejoice as with wine; and their children shall see it and be glad, their heart shall rejoice in the LORD.
I will whistle for them and gather them, for I have redeemed them, and they shall multiply as they once multiplied.
Though I scatter them among the peoples, yet in far countries they shall remember Me; and they shall live with their children, and return.
And I will bring them back from the land of Egypt, and from Assyria I will gather them; and to the land of Gilead and Lebanon I will bring them, and no place shall be found for them.

He shall pass through the sea of distress and strike the waves in the sea, and all the depths of the Nile shall be dried up; the pride of Assyria shall be brought down, and the scepter of Egypt shall depart.
And I will strengthen them in the LORD, and in his name they shall walk, declares the LORD.
Open your doors, O Lebanon, that fire may devour your cedars.
Wail, O cypress, for the cedar has fallen, because the mighty are laid waste; howl, O oaks of Bashan, for the dense forest has come down.
A voice of the wailing of the shepherds, for their glory is laid waste; a voice of the roaring of young lions, for the pride of the Jordan is laid waste.
Thus says the LORD my God: Shepherd the flock doomed to slaughter.
Whose buyers slay them and are not held guilty, and whose sellers say, “Blessed be the LORD, for I have become rich,” and their own shepherds do not spare them.

For I will no more have compassion upon the inhabitants of the land, declares the LORD; but behold, I am giving mankind, each one into the hand of his neighbor and into the hand of his king, and they shall crush the land, and I will not deliver out of their hand.

So I shepherded the flock marked for slaughter, truly the afflicted of the flock. And I took for myself two staffs; to the one I called Favor, and to the other I called Bonds, and I shepherded the flock.
And I cut off the three shepherds in one month; and my soul grew weary of them, and their soul also loathed me.
And I said, I will not shepherd you. That which is dying shall die, and that which is perishing shall perish, and those which are left shall each eat the flesh of her companion.
And I took my staff, Beauty, and cut it asunder, to break my covenant which I had made with all the peoples.
And it was broken in that day, and thus the afflicted of the flock who were watching me knew that it was the word of the LORD.
And I said to them, If it is good in your eyes, give me my wages; and if not, refrain. So they weighed out my wages, thirty pieces of silver.
And the LORD said to me, “Cast it to the potter, the splendid price at which I was valued by them.” So I took the thirty pieces of silver and cast them into the house of the LORD, to the potter.
Then I cut in pieces my second staff, Bands, to break the brotherhood between Judah and between Israel.
And the LORD said to me, Yet take for yourself again the implements of a foolish shepherd.

For behold, I am raising up a shepherd in the land who will not attend to those that are perishing, will not seek the young, and the broken he will not heal, and the one that stands he will not sustain; but the flesh of the fat he will eat, and their hoofs he will tear to pieces.

Woe to the worthless shepherd who forsakes the flock! A sword shall be upon his arm and upon his right eye; his arm shall wither, utterly wither, and his right eye shall be darkened, utterly darkened.
The burden of the word of the LORD concerning Israel: declares the LORD, who stretches out the heavens, and lays the foundation of the earth, and forms the spirit of man within him.
Behold, I am making Jerusalem a cup of reeling for all the peoples round about; and it shall also be upon Judah in the siege against Jerusalem.

And it shall come to pass in that day that I will make Jerusalem a heavy stone for all the peoples; all who burden themselves with it shall be lacerated, and all the nations of the earth shall be gathered against it.

In that day, declares the LORD, I will strike every horse with bewilderment, and its rider with madness; but upon the house of Judah I will open My eyes, while every horse of the peoples I will strike with blindness.
And the chiefs of Judah shall say in their heart, The inhabitants of Jerusalem are my strength in the LORD of hosts, their God.

In that day I will make the chiefs of Judah like a brazier of fire among the wood, and like a flaming torch among sheaves; and they shall devour on the right hand and on the left all the surrounding peoples, and Jerusalem shall yet again dwell in her own place, in Jerusalem.
And the LORD shall save the tents of Judah first, so that the glory of the house of David and the glory of the inhabitant of Jerusalem may not be magnified above Judah.

On that day the LORD will shield the inhabitant of Jerusalem, and the one who stumbles among them on that day shall be like David, and the house of David shall be like God, like the angel of the LORD before them.
And it shall come to pass in that day that I will seek to destroy all the nations that come against Jerusalem.

And I will pour out on the house of David and on the inhabitant of Jerusalem the Spirit of grace and supplications; and they shall look to Me whom they have pierced, and they shall mourn for Him as one mourns for an only son, and shall be in bitterness for Him as one that is in bitterness for a firstborn.
In that day the mourning in Jerusalem shall be great, like the mourning of Hadad-rimmon in the valley of Megiddo.
And the land shall mourn, every family apart; the family of the house of David apart, and their wives apart; the family of the house of Nathan apart, and their wives apart.
The clan of the house of Levi apart, and their wives apart; the clan of the Shimeites apart, and their wives apart.
All the families that remain, every family by itself, and their wives by themselves.
In that day a fountain shall be opened for the house of David and for the inhabitants of Jerusalem, for sin and for uncleanness.

And it shall come to pass in that day, declares the LORD of hosts, that I will cut off the names of the idols from the land, and they shall be remembered no more; and also I will cause the prophets and the spirit of uncleanness to pass out of the land.

And it shall come to pass, when a man yet prophesies, that his father and his mother who begot him shall say to him, You shall not live, for you have spoken lies in the name of the LORD; and his father and his mother who begot him shall pierce him through when he prophesies.
And it shall come to pass in that day that the prophets shall be ashamed, every one of his vision when he prophesies; and they shall not wear a hairy mantle to deceive.
And he shall say, I am no prophet; I am a man tilling the ground, for a man acquired me from my youth.
And one shall say to him, What are these wounds between your hands? And he shall say, Those with which I was struck in the house of my friends.

Sword, awake against My shepherd and against the man who is My companion, declares the LORD of hosts. Strike the shepherd, and the sheep shall be scattered, and I will turn My hand against the little ones.
And it shall come to pass in all the land, declares the LORD, that two parts in it shall be cut off and perish, but the third shall be left in it.

And I will bring the third part through the fire, and will refine them as silver is refined, and will test them as gold is tested. He shall call on My name, and I will answer him. I will say, “He is My people,” and he will say, “The LORD is my God.”
Behold, a day is coming for the LORD, when your spoil shall be divided in your midst.

And I will gather all the nations against Jerusalem to battle; and the city shall be taken, and the houses plundered, and the women ravished; and half of the city shall go forth into captivity, but the remnant of the people shall not be cut off from the city.
Then the LORD will go forth and fight against those nations, as in the day when He fights in the day of battle.

And his feet shall stand in that day upon the Mount of Olives, which is before Jerusalem on the east; and the Mount of Olives shall be split in two from its middle, eastward and westward, a very great valley; and half of the mountain shall move northward, and half of it southward.

And you shall flee by the valley of my mountains, for the valley of the mountains shall reach to Azal; and you shall flee as you fled from before the earthquake in the days of Uzziah king of Judah. Then the LORD my God shall come, and all the holy ones with you.
And it shall come to pass in that day, that there shall not be light; the precious ones shall congeal.
And it shall be one day, it is known to the LORD, not day and not night; and it shall come to pass that at evening time there shall be light.

And it shall come to pass in that day, that living waters shall go out from Jerusalem; half of them toward the eastern sea, and half of them toward the western sea; in summer and in winter shall it be.
And the LORD shall be King over all the earth; in that day the LORD shall be one, and His name one.

All the land shall be turned as the Arabah, from Geba to Rimmon south of Jerusalem; and she shall be lifted up and shall dwell in her place, from the Gate of Benjamin to the place of the First Gate, to the Corner Gate, and from the Tower of Hananel to the king’s winepresses.
And they shall dwell in it, and there shall be no more curse; and Jerusalem shall dwell in safety.

And this shall be the plague with which the LORD will strike all the peoples that have warred against Jerusalem: their flesh shall rot away while they stand upon their feet, and their eyes shall rot away in their sockets, and their tongue shall rot away in their mouth.

And it shall come to pass in that day that there shall be a great confusion from the LORD among them; and each one will seize the hand of his neighbor, and his hand shall rise up against the hand of his neighbor.
And Judah also shall fight at Jerusalem, and the wealth of all the nations round about shall be gathered, gold and silver and garments in great abundance.
And so shall be the plague of the horse, of the mule, of the camel, and of the donkey, and of every beast that shall be in those camps, as this plague.

And it shall come to pass, that everyone who is left of all the nations that came against Jerusalem shall go up year by year to bow themselves before the King, the LORD of hosts, and to keep the Feast of Booths.
And it shall be, that whoever of the families of the earth does not go up to Jerusalem to bow down before the King, the LORD of hosts, upon them there shall be no rain.
And if the family of Egypt does not go up and does not come, then upon them there shall be the plague with which the LORD will strike the nations that do not go up to keep the Feast of Booths.
This shall be the sin of Egypt, and the sin of all the nations that do not go up to keep the Feast of Booths.
In that day there shall be upon the bells of the horses, Holy to the LORD; and the pots in the house of the LORD shall be as the bowls before the altar.

And every pot in Jerusalem and in Judah shall be holy to the LORD of hosts, and all who sacrifice shall come and take of them and boil in them; and there shall no longer be a Canaanite in the house of the LORD of hosts in that day.
